    • Method Detail

      • getOrFetch

        public PlayerStatistic getOrFetch(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        This method will return a cached PlayerStatistic instance if existing, or fetch/create a new instance.
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose PlayerStatistic wants to be accessed/fetched
        Returns:
        returns either a cached PlayerStatistic instance or a new one

      • getOrFetch

        public PlayerStatistic getOrFetch(java.util.UUID uuid)
        This method will return a cached PlayerStatistic instance if existing, or fetch/create a new instance.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the player whose PlayerStatistic wants to be accessed/fetched
        Returns:
        returns either a cached PlayerStatistic instance or a new one through fetchOrCreate(UUID)

      • getStatistic

        public java.util.Optional<PlayerStatistic> getStatistic(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        This method gets the PlayerStatistic for a specific player
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose PlayerStatistic wants to be accessed
        Returns:
        this returns an Optional containing a PlayerStatistic object of the player or an Optional.empty() if no Statistics for the player could be found (Due to the Statistic not being fetched or the player not having a statistic yet)

      • getStatistic

        public java.util.Optional<PlayerStatistic> getStatistic(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
        This method gets the PlayerStatistic for a specific player
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose PlayerStatistic wants to be accessed
        Returns:
        this returns an Optional containing a PlayerStatistic object of the player or an Optional.empty() if no Statistics for the player could be found (Due to the Statistic not being fetched or the player not having a statistic yet) This method is similar to getStatistic(Player) except it accepts an OfflinePlayer as a parameter

      • getStatistic

        public java.util.Optional<PlayerStatistic> getStatistic(java.util.UUID uuid)
        This method gets the PlayerStatistic for a specific player
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the player whose PlayerStatistic wants to be accessed
        Returns:
        this returns an Optional containing a PlayerStatistic object of the player or an Optional.empty() if no Statistics for the player could be found (Due to the Statistic not being fetched or the player not having a statistic yet)

      • getPlayerStatistics

        public java.util.HashMap<java.util.UUID,PlayerStatistic> getPlayerStatistics()
        This method returns the entire Map of fetched PlayerStatistic
        Returns:
        this returns a HashMap containing all fetched PlayerStatistic

      • addStatistic

        public void addStatistic(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         Statistic statistic,
                         int amount)
        This method is meant to increase a Statistic with no (NONE) Substatistic
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose statistic should be increased
        statistic - the statistic that wants to be increased
        amount - the value by which the statistic should be increased This method is similar to PlayerStatistic.addStatistic(Statistic, int) but does not require the PlayerStatistic object of the player

      • addStatistic

        public void addStatistic(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         Statistic statistic,
                         org.bukkit.Material material,
                         int amount)
        This method is meant to increase a Statistic with a MATERIAL Substatistic
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose statistic should be increased
        statistic - the statistic that wants to be increased
        material - define the Material of the statistic
        amount - the value by which the statistic should be increased This method is similar to PlayerStatistic.addStatistic(Statistic, Material, int) but does not require the PlayerStatistic object of the player

      • addStatistic

        public void addStatistic(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         Statistic statistic,
                         org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType,
                         int amount)
        This method is meant to increase a Statistic with an ENTITY Substatistic
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose statistic should be increased
        statistic - the statistic that wants to be increased
        entityType - define the EntityType of a statistic
        amount - the value by which the statistic should be increased This method is similar to PlayerStatistic.addStatistic(Statistic, EntityType, int) but does not require the PlayerStatistic object of the player

      • fetchOrCreate

        public PlayerStatistic fetchOrCreate(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        This method is meant to either fetch fetchStatistics(UUID) an existing PlayerStatistic from the MySQL-Database or createStatistic(Player) if no Statistic could be found on the database
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose PlayerStatistic should be fetched/created
        Returns:
        this returns either a new PlayerStatistic for the player or an existing one fetched from the MySQL-Database

      • fetchOrCreate

        public PlayerStatistic fetchOrCreate(java.util.UUID uuid)
        This method is meant to either fetch fetchStatistics(UUID) an existing PlayerStatistic from the MySQL-Database or createStatistic(Player) if no Statistic could be found on the database
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the player whose PlayerStatistic should be fetched/created
        Returns:
        this returns either a new PlayerStatistic for the player or an existing one fetched from the MySQL-Database

      • saveStatistics

        public void saveStatistics()
        This method is meant to save all currently cached PlayerStatistic from getPlayerStatistics() asynchronously
